wikipedia_page.main: Francis Hugh Adam Marshall CBE FRS FRSE LLD (11 July 1878, High Wycombe – 5 February 1949, Cambridge) was a British physiologist who did pioneering early research into the physiology and endocrinology of biological reproduction.

link_mentions.page: List of professorships at the University of Cambridge

response: *Francis Marshall (U.S. Army officer) (1867–1922), U.S. Army general
*Francis Marshall (British Army officer) (1876–1942), British Army general

In 1931 he published Amoroso's first paper, on the epithelium of the pancreas. As Lord Zuckerman noted: "Then came others on diverse topics. Twenty years passed before he began to focus on the problem of placentation, with which his name will be best remembered. Here his gift of synthesis found full play. He threw new light on the evolutionary adaptation of the placenta for viviparous reproduction, his conclusions being based not just on his own researches and experience as a microanatomist and general biologist, but on his familiarity with the literature in several disciplines."Lord Zuckerman, "Emmanuel Ciprian Amoroso", Munk's Roll, 1901–1982, Vol. VII, p. 10, Royal College of Physicians. Amoroso's research into the placenta was published in Francis Marshall's Physiology of Reproduction in 1952. He published his last paper at the age of 80, having amassed more than 144 publications.
